Class MenuItem

java.lang.Object
menu.MenuItem
All Implemented Interfaces:
Runnable
public class MenuItem extends Object implements Runnable
Associates menu text with a response when selected. When printed, MenuItem prints the menuText. Calling run() invokes the menuResponse.

For example, 

MenuItem exitApp = new MenuItem("Exit", () -> endApp());
System.out.println(exitApp);    // prints "Exit"
exitApp.run();                  // calls endApp()

MenuItem is philisophically similar to Swing's JMenuItem, except that MenuItem relies on Runnable rather than ActionListener for the response.

Since:
1.0
Version:
1.1
Author:
Professor George F. Rice

      public boolean equals(Object o)
